comment.body: That's kind of how I've always argued for the importance of liveleaks. I don't like a lot of the content posted there, but it's important these materials remain available to view. To give an example: one of the most effective videos I've seen on there was one of someone getting electrocuted, ever since then I've made sure to not cut corners when working with high voltages. Seeing something go horribly wrong is one of the best ways to shock (haha) you into being more careful.
